column4: Can anyone help me create an entry on the launcher?  (Using 11.10)
I've installed gnuzilla... and I can run it fine from the terminal.
The instructions for adding items to the Launcher say to drag an icon from the dashboard...
But, when I type "icecat" into the dashboard... no results are shown from which to choose an icon...
Is there anyone who can help?  Please....
I had a guide on this open, lemme find it in the history
Ok, in the terminal, go to where your file is that you wanna shortcut and do "sudo ln -s [file]"
then copy that link file to /home/[username]/Desktop
Ok, try right-clicking on desktop and create a launcher with the path to your file
yeah, realised that after I tried it myself, was thinking of 11.04.

Fat32 doesn't support symbolic links. This means that you can't create a link _on_ the fat32 partition, but you should be able to make link to files that are on the partition. Right-click -> Make Link won't work, because it will try to create the link in the same directory as the original, on the fat32 partition.
